member.name: T:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.BasicAuthCredentials
member.summary: Pre-emptive basic auth credentials to match against

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.Id
member.summary: This stub mapping's unique identifier

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.Uuid
member.summary: Alias for the id

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.Name
member.summary: The stub mapping's name

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.Persistent
member.summary: Indicates that the stub mapping should be persisted immediately on create/update/delete and survive resets to default.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.Priority
member.summary: This stub mapping's priority relative to others. 1 is highest.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.ScenarioName
member.summary: The name of the scenario that this stub mapping is part of

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.RequiredScenarioState
member.summary: The required state of the scenario in order for this stub to be matched.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.NewScenarioState
member.summary: The new state for the scenario to be updated to after this stub is served.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.PostServeActions
member.summary: A map of the names of post serve action extensions to trigger and their parameters.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Mapping.Metadata
member.summary: Arbitrary metadata to be used for e.g. tagging, documentation. Can also be used to find and remove stubs.

member.summary: The HTTP request method

member.summary: The path and query to match exactly against

member.summary: The full URL to match against

member.summary: Header patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

member.summary: Cookie patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.NearMiss.Body
member.summary: Body string to match against

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.Method
member.summary: The HTTP request method e.g. GET

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.Url
member.summary: The path and query to match exactly against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.UrlPath
member.summary: The path to match exactly against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.UrlPathPattern
member.summary: The path regex to match against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.UrlPattern
member.summary: The path and query regex to match against. Only one of url, urlPattern, urlPath or urlPathPattern may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.QueryParameters
member.summary: Query parameter patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.Headers
member.summary: Header patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.BasicAuthCredentials
member.summary: Pre-emptive basic auth credentials to match against

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.Cookies
member.summary: Cookie patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Request.BodyPatterns
member.summary: Request body patterns to match against in the <key>: { "<predicate>": "<value>" } form

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.Status
member.summary: The HTTP status code to be returned

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.StatusMessage
member.summary: The HTTP status message to be returned

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.Headers
member.summary: Map of response headers to send

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.AdditionalProxyRequestHeaders
member.summary: Extra request headers to send when proxying to another host.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.Body
member.summary: The response body as a string. Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.Base64Body
member.summary: The response body as a base64 encoded string (useful for binary content). Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.JsonBody
member.summary: The response body as a JSON object. Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.BodyFileName
member.summary: The path to the file containing the response body, relative to the configured file root. Only one of body, base64Body, jsonBody or bodyFileName may be specified.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.Fault
member.summary: The fault to apply (instead of a full, valid response).

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.FixedDelayMilliseconds
member.summary: Number of milliseconds to delay be before sending the response.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.FromConfiguredStub
member.summary: Read-only flag indicating false if this was the default, unmatched response. Not present otherwise.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.ProxyBaseUrl
member.summary: The base URL of the target to proxy matching requests to.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.TransformerParameters
member.summary: Parameters to apply to response transformers.

member.name: P:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.Response.Transformers
member.summary: List of names of transformers to apply to this response.

member.name: T:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.ResponseLogNormal
member.summary: Log normal randomly distributed response delay.

member.name: T:WireMock.Org.Abstractions.ResponseLogUniformlyDistributed
member.summary: Uniformly distributed random response delay.

member.summary: The scenario ID

member.summary: The scenario name
